question.title: How do you find max of certain item in arraylist in Java with parameter of age is less than average age?
question.body:
I'm trying to build program in java which asks for information about basketball players and tells user which one basketball player is the tallest whose age is less than or equal to the average age.

In the main program which the user interacts directly with I have the following.

public class Project1{
     private int agesum;
//Some variables at start of program.

I have an arraylist called players with which the user input I add to it the name, age and height of players based of the user input. I have the playerheight stored as a type named Height which calculates the height based off given feet and inches using another class. To get the tallest player I have this however it's been giving me an error.

Optional<Object> tallestheight = players.stream().max((Comparator<? super Object>) playerheight);

The error is:

this class Height cannot be cast to class java.util.Comparator (Height is in unnamed module of loader 'app'; java.util.Comparator is in module java.base of loader 'bootstrap') at Project1.main(Project1.java:112)

How do I write this to not get an error?
